OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.quote: AMFAUNA-1 was in touch with Identity-52, a (nephew of Osvaldo RAMIREZ)

OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.description: Reference to continuing to protect information identifying coverage of other countries and individuals other than Lee Harvey Oswald
OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.quote: We would want to continue protection of the information which identifies coverage of other countries and individuals other than Lee Harvey Oswald

OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.description: Discussion of Oswald's presence at stations and potential intelligence connections
OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.quote: Ellie said there was the possibility of opening windows of stations when Oswald was present

OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.description: Document mentions Oswald in context of station windows and Agency/Directorate decision-making
OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.quote: when Oswald was present, however, this was a key issue for the Agency and a senior Directorate/Agency decision.

OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.description: Document refers to subject as an 'outside agent' with connections to KUBARK and LIHUFF/2 organizations
OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.quote: Subject was originally recruited as a cutout for the LIHUFF/2 organization. However, his actual duties for KUBARK entail far more than initial contact.

OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.description: Document references 'JORGE SERGIO OSWALDO' in connection with Cuban liberation committee
OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.quote: RAUL ROBLEJO LORIE, IS - CUBA and SERGIO OSWALDO BETANCOURT COLLAZO, aka - PSI, IS - CUBA

OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.description: References to a person named 'JORGE' who appears to work for or be connected to the Pentagon and intelligence activities
OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.quote: SUB-SOURCE THAT BOTH CRIZCNCO AND ''JORGE'' WORK FOR THE PENTAGON AND ALSO MENTION CRIZCNCO'S VISITS ON 8 AND 11 JANUARY

OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.description: Document discusses Eduardo Espinosa y Prieto, a possible connection to communist workers
OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.quote: reveals that your active communist workers of Mexico City were not active

OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.description: Ongoing surveillance and investigation of subject's potential communist activities
OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.quote: The people on this list are being contacted for use on a continuing basis in their specific cases rising in their particular area of knowledge.

OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.description: Document about Osvaldo Relova, a Cuban Intelligence officer with potential indirect connection to Oswald
OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.quote: A former Cuban IS officer who served with the Cuban Intelligence Service until April 1964

OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.description: Detailed information about Osvaldo RELOVA, a Cuban Embassy official connected to Oswald's activities
OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.quote: Osvaldo RELOVA, First Secretary of the Cuban Embassy in Canada, left Kingston for Toronto on 21 October 1963, on TCA flight number 885.

OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.description: Document discusses Cuban-American intelligence networks and potential recruitment
OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.quote: Ex-Captain in the U.S.A.F. See Pgs 201 for full details

OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.description: Reference to possible intelligence agent handlers and identities
OSWALD_ASSOCIATIONS.quote: AGENT HANDLER 'TORRES', 'JORGE' ... REF B) HAS SINCE IDENTIFIED HIMSELF TO MRS. A-9 AS 'TORRES'

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA confirms diligent record searches related to JFK Assassination Records Review Board
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: The Central Intelligence Agency: (a) has made diligent records searches to locate and disclose to the JFK Assassination Records Review Board (the Board) all records in its possession relating to Lee Harvey Oswald and the assassination of President Kennedy

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Investigations focused on potential assassination capabilities and methods
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Notheless, as a part of these investigations they yielded information which, to many, appeared to relate in some way to the assassination, such as an operational capability or willingness to consider assassination as an intelligence method.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Extensive CIA and FBI documentation related to Oswald and assassination investigation
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Boxes 35 through 63 consist of reports, memoranda, transcripts, cables, letters, newspaper clippings, photographs, and charts.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA document details search methodologies for JFK assassination-related materials since 1992 JFK Act
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Since 1992 and the passage of the JFK Act, CIA has, in responding to the requests of the Board, had to devise search methodologies and techniques to address both the hard copy and electronic versions of our databases.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA anti-Cuban operations during Oswald's timeframe
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: CIA anti-Cuban operations 1960-64 if they involve JFK figures or subjects; most US anti-Castro activities in 1963 are considered relevant

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA Historical Review Group conducted search on Lee Harvey Oswald records in October 1993
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: In October 1993, following enactment of the JFK Act but prior to the President's appointment of the Board, CIA's Historical Review Group (HRG) requested the CIA directorates to conduct a name search on Lee Harvey Oswald, JFK assassination, and any related documents

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Extensive document collection and transfer of assassination-related records
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: More than thirty-one additional boxes of materials were sent to HRG for review. Included were nineteen boxes of JFK working files, Russ Holmes' files, CIA employee records, boxes on Nosenko, Latin American division documents

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Mentions Board's focus on 'sequestered' CIA records related to Assassination Investigation
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Up to now, the Board has focused on the 'sequestered' records CIA had collected for the House Assassination Committee investigation and documents that had been part of the Oswald 201 file.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: New search of JFK assassination counterintelligence files being conducted
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: New Search of CI Files for JFK Assassination Records

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Comprehensive search protocol for JFK assassination records across multiple databases
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Search terms in paragraph 5-on ANY OF FILES which may contain information relating in any way to the JFK assassination

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA engaged in extensive document review and declassification process for JFK assassination records
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: CIA, during 1992 and 1993, reviewed for declassification material which had been sequestered following the investigation of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) in 1978.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Document describes CIA document review process involving retired officers with extensive Agency experience
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Each document in the collection was read by an Historical Reviewer Program (HRP) Reviewer -- in every case a retired officer with at least two decades of Agency experience

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Mention of sensitive CIA operations and investigations related to JFK assassination era
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Material from the Rockefeller Commission and Church Committee investigations, presidential libraries and PFIAB files which addressed the entire scope of CIA activities raised issues with respect to relevance to the JFK assassination.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Extensive searches conducted for Oswald-related volumes and files, with some inconsistencies in filing and storage
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: A second thorough search of the OS file system failed to produce any record of Volume V.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA analysis of audio surveillance tapes from Cuban and Soviet embassies in Mexico City during immediate post-assassination period
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: In our search efforts we did locate approximately 185 audio surveillance tapes of the Cuban and Soviet embassies in Mexico City that were recorded during the immediate time following the assassination (22 November 1963 to January 1964).

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Court-ordered destruction of HTLINGUAL surveillance files
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: CIA was directed by court order to destroy all HTLINGUAL material

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA worked closely with JFK Assassination Records Review Board, providing documents related to Oswald Pre-Assassination File
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: On each request, the CIA worked closely with the Board and Board staff to provide the information and/or documents requested and a written response which records such actions.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Comprehensive CIA records review related to JFK assassination
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: JFK Assassinations Records Review Board Requests for Additional Information and Records

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Internal CIA investigation of Oswald-related documents and files
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: CIA-IR-10: Determination if CIA IG maintains an index of reports and determine if one was done on handling of Oswald matters

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Extensive CIA informal requests tracking surveillance and files
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: CIA-IR-15: Mexico City Station electronic surveillance and surveillance tapes

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA informal requests involving files and investigations
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Files of CIA officials/offices

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA document discussing pre-assassination files on Lee Harvey Oswald
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Request for Additional Information and Records No. CIA-16 (Oswald Pre-Assassination Files)

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Multiple agency documents tracking Oswald
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Report Summary prepared by Soviet Russia Division forwarded to Office of Security in March 1960

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Central Intelligence Agency involved in distributing reports about Oswald
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Most likely because of counterintelligence concerns, the Central Intelligence Agency was included in the distribution of these reports.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Security Research Staff (SRS) role in intelligence gathering and counterintelligence
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: The Security Research Staff (SRS) was the component responsible for collecting, developing, and evaluating information of a counterintelligence nature

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA destroyed all HTLINGUAL files related to Oswald under court order
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: We did not review all of the DO record system to destroy all copies of material which may have been derived from HTLINGUAL material.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Detailed processing plan for CIA assassination records
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Per agreement with Review Board, the declassification review of all records, unless specifically designated for post-September 1998 processing by the Review Board

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA preparing to review and return unreviewed third-party referral documents related to JFK assassination
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: The CIA proposes that it complete its review and return to originating agency by April 1999 all unreviewed third agency referral documents which were received prior to 30 September 1998.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Detailed breakdown of record collections including CIA staff files
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: personnel files of CIA staff employees (approximately 5 reels)

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA document detailing anti-Cuban operations and surveillance of key figures
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: CIA anti-Cuban operations 1960-64 (Mongoose, etc.) if they involve JFK figures

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Efforts to address and potentially limit conspiracy theories about JFK assassination
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: The whole six year effort was designed to put rest all of the conspiracy theories and this comment would undercut the effort.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Ongoing effort to search and review records related to JFK assassination
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: On 21 August, Mr. Harrelson contacted me for a further search of DI records, specifically that the DI follow up on a previously search by extending the timeframe covered in that original search.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Confidential memos and reports tracking global reactions and propaganda
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: FBIS study, never disseminated, entitled: The Past Soviet Propaganda Assessment of President Johnson

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Multiple document collections related to JFK assassination being reviewed and processed
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: The OIG located six documents that may be relevant to the JFK assassination.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Multiple CIA file searches conducted on individuals potentially connected to Oswald case
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: The DA conducted file searches in OS and HRM for records on Theodore Shackley, Ronald Cross, Bart Henry, Doug Gupton, David Morales

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Computer search on specific individuals, including multiple CIA/intelligence personnel file searches
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: CIA-IR-19 Computer Search on Specific Individuals and Organizations

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA internal review of Oswald-related files and search procedures
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: The Nagell, Novel and Ruby files were designated assassination records and copies were provided to HRP.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Detailed questions about OS/SRS file management and security clearances for Oswald
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: How are these designations assigned? Does OS process security clearances for non-employees (e.g. sources)

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Reference to potential records about Oswald in various organizational files
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Records on operations and/or projects in which the Office of Security was involved in the past have most likely been destroyed, unless they are maintained because of congressional directives or the records control schedules.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Document is a request for information about pre-assassination files on Oswald
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: The Office of Personnel Security has researched this request from the Assassination Records Review Board relating to the existence of pre-assassination files on Lee Harvey Oswald.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Files related to Oswald were part of Management Data Program/Personnel Security system
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: These files were originally miscellaneous files which were converted to the above numbers circa 1964

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Document discusses internal reorganization of Security Analysis Group and Counterintelligence Center (CIC) functions
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: CIC assumed many of the functions previously conducted by the Security Analysis Group.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Defectors File and document handling related to Oswald
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: As the number of documents on this person increased, a separate file was created to be the repository of information on the alleged American defector.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Document describes the Security Research Staff (SRS) as a counterintelligence component that collected and evaluated intelligence
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: The Security Research Staff (SRS) was the component responsible for collecting, developing, and evaluating information of a counterintelligence nature to detect and/or prevent penetration of the Agency's organization, employees, and activities by foreign or domestic organizations or individuals.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Systematic destruction of Oswald-related files
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: All of the HTLINGUAL files were destroyed on 8 April 1994 along with numerous soft files

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Detailed tracking of US citizens and foreign nationals defecting
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: The Defectors File (#0341008) was established circa 1950 for the purpose of recording information on US citizens defecting to other countries and information regarding foreign nationals considering defection to the United States

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Document details internal reorganization of intelligence groups handling defector files
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: CIC assumed many of the functions previously conducted by the Security Analysis Group.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Extensive documentation tracking Oswald across multiple agencies
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Documents were located in a subsequent volume of the Oswald file and also appear to predate the assassination of President Kennedy

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Internal CIA document about search for files related to Warren Commission critics
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: This is with reference to your 2 February 1993 memorandum (Tab A) and our subsequent telephone conversation on 6 February wherein you requested that the Disclosure Office (DA) search for files on records of Warren Commission critics

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Internal CIA memorandum about search requests for specific individuals related to historical review
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: This is in response to your 3 August 1998 memorandum [...] wherein you requested that the Directorate of Administration (DA) conduct searches on the following names

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Communication between CIA/IRO departments about record searches
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: CCS has no record for the organizations listed below.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: LeWinter volunteered information about Agency operations
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: LeWinter volunteered to provide information about Agency operations overseas.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA report documenting intelligence fabricator and drug dealer interactions
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: CIA has report of an episode involving an intelligence fabricator and convicted drug dealer involving Oswald LeWinter, George Mearak, Oscar LeWinter, Ibrahim Razin

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Multiple individuals with potential intelligence connections
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: MARTIN, Jack. CCS records reflect three following individuals who may or may not be identifiable with your request.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Multiple searches conducted for records related to Oswald
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: CIA-IR-16 U-2 Files. The DS&T provided the Board a copy of the U-2 shelflist. We also searched for records filed under Richard Bissell's name.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA Central Intelligence Agency document about records management and information systems
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: I am the JFK Focal point Officer ('FPO') for the Directorate of Operations ('DO') of the United States Central Intelligence Agency ('CIA')

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA issued agency-wide employee bulletin for new JFK Assassination records search in July 1998
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: The CIA is issued an Agency-wide employee bulletin for a new search for JFK Assassination records (OIM 98-0081, dated 30 July 1998).

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Detailed CIA organizational records request covering multiple sensitive areas
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: CIA-1 - Information on the organization of CIA

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Request for comprehensive CIA organizational charts and related materials
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: The March 1995 ARRB request called for the availability of 'comprehensive organizational charts (or the best available substitutes)'

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Document reveals CIA ARRB (Assassination Records Review Board) requests for information about CIA operations in 1961-1963
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: in April 1998, we agreed to provide structure charts for the DDP in 1961 and 1963, with Division and Staff titles and a JMWAVE Chart.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA request for systematic review of cable traffic between Mexico City and JMWAVE from September-December 1963
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: This ARRB request was dated September 1995 and was for 'the CIA to assemble all of the cable traffic and dispatches for . . . September 26, 1963 through October 20, 1963 and November 22, 1963 through December 30, 1963 between' . . . Mexico City and Headquarters and Mexico City and JMWAVE.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Cables and dispatches from specific period were not fully preserved
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: The DO provided a classified response in January 1998. All cable traffic and dispatches for the period... are not available as a chronological collection.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA document discussing search for materials related to Sylvia Duran and JMWAVE-connected individuals
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: IMS/ESG searched its main index system, its 'names' data base, and hard copy files.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Document indicates inability to confirm or provide certain files
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: The DO maintains no files on former employees, such as Morales, Shackley, or Gupton (P).

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA Mexico City Station annual reports from 1957-1973 were reviewed, with some documents missing or not located
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: RMDs for Mexico City Station, for the years 1962, 1963, or 1964 could not be located.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA destroyed Oswald-related files under court order
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: We destroyed all of the HTLINGUAL files under court order, and no record was made of what files existed.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Multiple CIA internal review requests related to JFK assassination files
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: The DO provided the following unclassified response about the Angleton Files

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA referenced a 'Garrison Investigation of Kennedy Assassination' file opened in 1969 and closed in 1996
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: A file titled 'Garrison Investigation of Kennedy Assassination' was opened in 1969 and closed in 1996

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA document discusses contacts with journalists and publishing houses, likely related to propaganda efforts
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: The DO provided both an unclassified and classified response about contacts with journalists or publishing houses, regarding whether CIA might have attempted to influence any journalists or publishers regarding public discussion of the assassination.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA research and investigation activities related to Charles Ford and potential organized crime connections
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: (S) As part of DA/OIM/JFK's research, IMS/ESG/HCS was requested to do a trace on 'Charles Ford.' The trace resulted in no hits.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA Defector Staff office handling Soviet bloc defector cases
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Only Soviet Bloc (formerly Warsaw Pact countries) defector cases were handled by this branch. Staffs and branches identified, among other duties, were responsible for identifying, debriefing, and resettling foreign defectors of intelligence interest.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Reference to a microfilm collection of files from Michelle Combs related to a 'SECRET' classified memo about file organization
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: (U) This is a large number of files from the microfilm part of the collection that Michelle Combs reviewed and then crafted a 'SECRET' classified memo identifying the reels and folders of files that were then declared 'Not Believed Relevant.'

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Multiple CIA internal research reports about JFK assassination-related individuals
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: CIA-IR-21 -- DRE Monthly operational reports, CIA-IR-22 -- "A" file on Clay Shaw and Jim Garrison

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA report about LeWinter as an intelligence fabricator and drug dealer
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: CIA has a report of an episode involving an intelligence fabricator and convicted drug dealer Oswald LeWinter, AKA George Mearah, born 2 April 1931, in Vienna, Austria.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: CIA AMWORLD operation targeting Cuban exile groups for potential overthrow of Fidel Castro
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: AMWORLD's mission was to cause a popular uprising in Cuba through the use of propaganda and paramilitary forces to ultimately overthrow Fidel Castro.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Extensive document review process for JFK assassination records
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: IMS/ESG/HCS ran a computer search for 'OPI 40' files... Her review encompasses some 42 boxes from a variety of retired DDP files.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Routing of classified communications about Oswald across multiple international stations
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Routing with addresses to Paris, Rome, Madrid, Copenhagen, Oslo, Helsinki, Brussels, The Hague, London, and Ottawa

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Top Secret documents related to US Policy Towards Cuba from January 1963
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: US Policy Towards Cuba (TOP SECRET)

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Detailed study to be made by CIA with other Departments on vulnerabilities in Cuba
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Detailed study to be made by CIA with other Departments of possible weaknesses and vulnerabilities in elements which control Cuba.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: References to policy and planning regarding Cuban relations
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Policy Toward non-bloc ships in Cuban trade (Action US Government proposes to take with regard to shipping to Cuba)

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Document relates to Cuba overflight intelligence gathering operations
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Presidential directive approved... requested CIA to come up with an estimate of the adequacy of such a system of intelligence collection

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: U.S. government prepared to employ multiple pressure tactics against Cuba
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Being prepared to meet, with the employment of appropriate U.S. combat elements and/or logistical support, the wide variety of military contingencies that may arise

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Secret document outlining potential actions against Cuba, involving negotiations with Fidel Castro
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: With respect to the actions listed below, the results of Mr. Donovan's imminent negotiations with Fidel Castro for freeing the 20-odd American prisoners should first be ascertained.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Proposed OAS resolutions targeting Cuba
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: An OAS resolution condemning Cuba for its actions which continue to endanger the peace, deploying refusal to allow inspection, condemning the presence of Soviet troops, recommending continued surveillance and continued vigilance against subversive activities

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Detailed strategic planning for coordinated international action against Cuba
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: We will seek to get agreement from Free World industrial nations to prevent shipping of critical spare parts and equipment to Cuba

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Secret document outlining covert operations against Cuba
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: In addition to current covert programs such as intelligence collection, recruitment of Cuban officials, support of the Cuban Revolutionary Council (CRC) and other exile activities, infiltration of propaganda materials, and radio broadcasts, the following are recommended for approval and immediate initiation:

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Policy document outlining US objectives regarding Cuba
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Protecting the security of the United States and the other states of the Organization of American States (OAS) by ensuring that offensive weapons are not reintroduced into Cuba

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Outlines covert US government strategy against Cuba
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Maximizing the political isolation of the Castro regime from other free world states, and especially from states of the OAS

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Diplomatic strategy for addressing Cuba and Soviet bloc trade
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: prohibit any cargo sponsored by any department or agency of the United States from being shipped on vessels owned or controlled by persons who own or control vessels engaged in trade between Cuba and the Soviet bloc

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Secret document outlining contingency plans against Castro/Communist regime in Cuba
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Our contingency planning should include preparations for large-scale use of Cubans inside Cuba; more extensive air activity including both high and low level flights primarily directed toward surveillance

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Detailed covert action plan against Castro/Communist regime in Cuba
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Such actions might include leaflet dropping; propaganda urging sabotage, strikes, and opposition to the regime; psychological operations urging defections...

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Reference to managing international perception of U.S. policy regarding Cuba
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: If properly handled, the overt aspects of this policy may serve not only to mitigate any unfavorable reactions from other countries, but also to gain, particularly in Latin America, increasing appreciation of the threat of Castro/Communist Cuba.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Top Secret document discussing U.S. policy towards Communist Cuba and Castro regime
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: The active pursuit of our objective will make it clear that the U.S. will not permit the maintenance of a communist base in the hemisphere.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Top Secret document outlining U.S. objectives regarding Cuba and Soviet influence
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Reducing the capabilities of the Castro regime to direct and support subversion and insurrection within the other OAS states

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Proposed diplomatic actions against Cuba and Soviet bloc
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: d. prohibit any cargo sponsored by any department or agency of the United States from being shipped on vessels owned or controlled by persons who own or control vessels engaged in the trade between Cuba and the Soviet bloc.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Document appears to be a top-secret CIA/OAS plan for actions against Cuba
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: In addition to current covert programs such as intelligence collection, radio broadcasts, recruitment of Cuban official agencies, support of the Cuban Revolutionary Council (CRC) activities, and infiltration of propaganda materials...

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Top secret document outlining contingency plans for overthrowing the Castro/Communist regime in Cuba
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: In addition to these immediate actions, we should make preparations now so that we are able to seize opportunities for more positive action towards our ultimate objective of the overthrow of the Castro/Communist regime.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: US government plan for covert actions against Cuban regime
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: The U.S. Government will apply increasing degrees of political, economic, psychological pressures, as appropriate until the Castro/Communist regime is overthrown.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Document appears to be a secret policy document about actions against Cuba, suggesting extensive intelligence gathering and covert operations
CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.quote: Intensive, comprehensive and continuing intelligence gathering in depth on Cuba should be identified as a primary objective of the national intelligence effort.

CIA_FBI_ACTIVITIES.description: Secret document discussing U.S. policy toward Castro's Cuba, indicating strategic planning for regime change

CIA_RECORDKEEPING.description: CIA maintained decentralized record-keeping systems with different procedures across directorates
CIA_RECORDKEEPING.quote: For most of its history, the Agency has had a system of records which has been shaped by the divergent requirements of the directorates in accordance with the wide variance of focus in their missions.

ASSASSINATION_INVESTIGATION.description: Sequestered collection focused on JFK Assassination investigation materials
ASSASSINATION_INVESTIGATION.quote: Today, the sequestered collection comprises the great bulk of CIA-originated documents which can be associated with the JFK Assassination and related investigations.

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Electronic database search techniques used for comprehensive records review
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: Electronic files searches can actually be more complex than manual searches, in major part because of the number of different electronic systems in use.

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Significant interest in locating electronic surveillance tapes of Oswald's Mexico City visit
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: There has been considerable interest over the years in locating any electronic surveillance tapes that would have been made during the period that Oswald visited Mexico City (26 September - 2 October 1963).

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Searches and inquiries about Oswald-related computer files
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: CIA-IR-09: George Bush computer search

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Specific mention of surveillance tapes from Mexico City
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: Tapes from 22-23 Nov. '63 have been processed and are available to NARA

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: SRS maintained detailed records on individuals of counterintelligence interest
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: SRS maintained records identifying personalities, environments, and personal traits of individuals who had been of counterintelligence interest over the years

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Inquiry about records of OS operations and liaison cooperation
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: Where are records that would describe liaison (etc.) cooperation or operations between OS and CI located?

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Index cards tracked detailed personal information on individuals
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: Cards included names (primary, alias, telecodes), file numbers, kinzlatives, location/residence, DPOB, citizenship, occupation, polygraph number, reference source data, information codes, remarks, SSN, sex, employer, and file retirement data.

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Establishes a systematic tracking file on US citizens defecting
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: The Defectors File (#0341008) was established circa 1950 for the purpose of recording information on US citizens defecting to other countries

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Specific file creation and management for Oswald
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: As the number of documents on this person increased, a separate file was created to be the repository of information on the alleged American defector.

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Detailed account of audio surveillance tapes related to Oswald's Mexico City visit
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: There has been considerable interest over the years in locating any electronic surveillance tapes that would have been made during the period that Oswald visited Mexico (26 September - 2 October 1963)

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Specific details about surveillance tape collection and destruction
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: Approximately 185 audio surveillance tapes of the Cuban and Soviet embassies in Mexico City were recorded during the immediate time following the assassination (22 November 1963 to January 1964)

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Detailed physical description of González Vega, including height, weight, and appearance
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: LIRING/9 described Heriberto González Vega as a 'rather tall' (about 1.78) heavy (about 85-90 k.), apparent age 42, with light eyes ('ojos claros') and straight ('lacio') black hair

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Reference to contact with Jose Ignacio Roclando (Lopez) Ruiz in jail
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: ROCLANDO(LOPEZ) RUIZ WITH WHOM HAD CONTACT IN JAIL. PLS ADVISE ETA BY IMMEDIATE.

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Searching for additional surveillance records of Oswald
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: On numerous occasions, the Review Board has asked whether there was any surveillance take in addition to what is currently in the collection.

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Mexico City CIA files potentially containing surveillance information
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: CIA apparently has preserved certain recordings from Mexico City that post-date the assassination

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Detailed meeting and communication record involving Cuban exile and military/political contacts
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: ON 4 AUG HE HAD ACCOMPANIED 'HIS WASHINGTON DELEGATE' GENARDO MORA TO HOME OF COL. KELLY WHO... HAS WIDE MILITARY CONTACT WASHINGTON BY VIRTUE MOB POSITION

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: FBI monitoring case involving potential Cuban connections
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: FBI WAS INFORMED AND THEY HAVE BEEN MONITORING CASE

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Guidance to monitor student groups and activities
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: WATCH STUDENT GROUPS FOR DEMONSTRATIONS, ARTICLES AND PUBLIC STATEMENTS... INTERVIEW TRAINED STUDENTS, GOVERNMENT OFFICIALS, EDUCATORS FOR REACTION

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: System for maintaining detailed personal dossiers on individuals
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: The 201 Dossier: the official file containing the 201 opening form and all biographical reporting on and references to the individual

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Detailed tracking of covert employee's status and potential future assignments
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: The Subject is still a covert employee of this Agency, is now in the United States (New York City) on home leave, and is scheduled to report to Washington, D.C., to commence four weeks of covert training: 6 July 1951.

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Interview checklist with multiple security-related points
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: Personal Conduct (a. general good behavior, b. no black market or currency transactions, c. no undue curiosity in natives)

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Multiple wave/communication references indicating ongoing intelligence monitoring
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: REFS A) WAVE 8316 (IN 70529) B) WAVE 8346 (IN 70905)

SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.description: Mention of coverage and potential surveillance adjustments
SURVEILLANCE_RECORDS.quote: IF NECESSARY TO EFFECT COVERAGE ON LINE, STATION MAY SUSPEND COVERAGE AMESS/1 BUT PREFER MAINTAIN BOTH.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: KGB interest in Oswald documented
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: KGB interest in Oswald

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Reference to new documents related to Soviet Union and recent defector reports
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: including references to a variety of reasons... records made available because of the break up of the Soviet Union

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Reference to CIA anti-Castro operations
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Project MONGOOSE, a clandestine position of the publicly acknowledged U.S. anti-Castro policy, was released.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Early document referencing Oswald's interactions with Soviet authorities
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Department of State telegram #1304 from Moscow dated 31 October 1959

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Multiple cables from Mexico City related to Oswald time period
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Incoming cables from Mexico City dated 20 July 1963, 17 August 1963, 9 October 1963, and 24 October 1963

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Records include Cuban and Soviet-linked investigative materials
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Cubans, Americans, and Soviets linked to Oswald, the JFK assassination or various investigations

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Document mentions KGB officer in Mexico City and Cuban embassy connections
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: -- Valeriy Kostikov, KGB Officer in Mexico City; -- Silvia Duran, employee in Cuban Embassy, Mexico City

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Multiple documents related to international reactions and analysis of Kennedy's assassination
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Fidel Castro's Speech, which contained an 'objective analysis' of implications of Kennedy's assassination

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Multiple documents related to Oswald's interactions with Soviet entities
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Department of State telegram #1304 from Moscow dated 31 October 1959

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Incoming cables from Mexico City with potential Oswald-related intelligence
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Incoming cable #63S58 from Mexico City dated 20 July 1963 (no mention of Oswald)

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Multiple Department of State communications about Oswald's status
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Documents include Department of State telegrams from Moscow and Tokyo dated November 1959

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Multiple communications from Mexico City related to Oswald
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Incoming cable #83858 from Mexico City dated 20 July 1963 (no mention of Oswald)

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Mention of Oswald's connections to foreign documents and research services
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Foreign Documents Division/00 requested a clearance on Spas T. Raikin for unclassified contact employment with U.S. Joint Publications Research Service in New York City

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Mentions overseas interactions and potential defection attempts
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: US representative overseas reported that LeWinter, using the name of George Mearak, contacted GDR officials wishing to defect

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Attempted contact with East German officials for potential defection
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: LeWinter, using the name of George Mearah, contacted him and offered to put high-level GDR officials wishing to defect in touch with our representative and in turn the CIA.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: CIA support for Cuban exile groups with indirect operational involvement
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: The Agency provided direct and indirect financial aid and technical advisory support to these groups but did not participate directly in the day-to-day operations.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: No evidence of Cuban Government in Exile
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: there was never a Cuban Government in Exile. The invasion site was never secured.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Multiple NSC action items related to Cuba policy and contingency planning
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Contingency Planning for Cuba

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Document references papers about United States Policy Toward Cuba
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: United States Policy Toward Cuba

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: US policy stance on preventing Cuban aggression and communist expansion
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: We will neither initiate nor permit aggression in this hemisphere.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: US aims to discourage Cuban alignment with Sino-Soviet bloc
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Encouraging and supporting any developments within Cuba that offer the possibility of divorcing the Cuban Government from its support of Sino-Soviet Communist purposes

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Document discusses U.S. strategies against Castro regime and Cuba
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Maximizing the political isolation of the Castro regime from other free world states, and especially from states of the OAS.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Detailed plan to support Cuban exiles in overthrowing Castro regime
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Support the efforts of certain Cuban exiles, who are associated with the original aims of the 26 of July Movement and who believe that the Castro regime can be overthrown from within

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Detailed plan for potential maritime actions against Cuba
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Close United States ports to all vessels of a country whose vessels engage in carrying arms to Cuba

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Diplomatic strategy regarding Cuba and Soviet Bloc relations
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: At the termination of the U. S. Chiefs of Mission Conference - January 20-30, or at a later date dependent on the Donovan mission, Assistant Secretary Martin, or another representative of the President will visit the Presidents of Chile, Mexico and Brazil to convey the importance President Kennedy attaches to maintaining hemispheric solidarity

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Document appears to be a SECRET file discussing OAS (Organization of American States) actions regarding Cuba
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: prohibition of ships of OAS member states from transporting embargoed items and deny use of ports to ships in Bloc-Cuba trade

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Potential motivations for action against Castro regime
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: New opportunities for accomplishing our objectives may arise either as a result of Bloc action in other parts of the world; as a result of aggressive moves (or isolated hostile actions) by the Castro-Communist regime itself

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Potential Soviet involvement consideration
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Removal of remaining Soviet forces from Cuba because taking these actions could provide the U.S.S.R. with rationale for maintaining its forces in Cuba.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Top secret draft document about United States policy toward Cuba
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: United States Policy Toward Cuba

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Document discusses US objectives regarding Cuba and Soviet influence
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Reducing the capabilities of the Castro regime to dissect and support subversion and insurrections within the other OAS states

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Discussion of OAS resolutions condemning Cuba and Soviet involvement
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: condemning the presence of Soviet troops, recommending cessation of subversive activities, and terminating the invocation of the Rio Treaty on the missile crisis

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Detailed plans for covert actions against Cuba, including intelligence gathering and supporting Cuban exiles
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: In addition to current covert programs such as intelligence collection, radio broadcasts, recruitment of Cuban officials as agents, support of Cuban Revolutionary Council (CRC), activities, and infiltration of propaganda materials are recommended for approval and immediate initiation.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Document indicates potential scenarios for regime change in Cuba
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: These opportunities may arise either as a result of Bloc action in other parts of the world, as a result of aggressive moves (or isolated hostile acts) by the Castro/Communist regime itself; or as a result of uprisings or internal conflict within Cuba

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Planned actions against Cuban government including intelligence gathering and psychological warfare
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Large scale training of Cubans in the U.S. and the use of such Cubans inside Cuba

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Discussion of potential international political reactions, specifically Latin American governments' potential response to U.S. actions
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: They may attack the U.S. for 'intervening' or they may react favorably (as they did during the missile crisis).

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: US policy aims to prevent Cuban aggression and subversion
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: We shall neither initiate nor permit aggression in this hemisphere

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Document discusses Cuban-Sino-Soviet relations
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Encouraging and supporting any developments within Cuba that offer the possibility of divorcing the Cuban Government from its support of Sino-Soviet Communist purposes

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Document discusses diplomatic communications and actions related to Cuba and Soviet Union
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: At the continuation of the U. S. Chiefs of Mexico Conference in El Salvador on January 28-30, Assistant Secretary Martin will visit the Presidents of Chile, Mexico and Brazil to convey to them the importance President Kennedy attaches to maintaining hemispheric solidarity by supporting the following resolutions:

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Detailed plan for coordinating actions with NATO allies against Cuba
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: We will inform our NATO allies of the impending OAS action.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Plans for military intervention with Latin American support
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: U.S. military forces employed against Cuba should be accompanied by U.S. militarily-trained free Cubans and by the armed forces of those Latin American nations desirous of participating in the U.S. effort.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: US policy document outlines strategies to isolate Cuba from Soviet Bloc and reduce Russian influence
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Increase the cost to the Bloc of sustaining the regime; and obtain the withdrawal of Russian troops from Cuba.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Discusses potential Soviet and Castro regime responses to US actions
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Soviet actions that threaten the peace or security of the hemisphere. This does not not preclude appropriate U.S. retaliation for isolated hostile acts by the Castro/Communist or Soviet forces.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Potential international political consequences analysis
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: From the standpoint of international politics, the U.S. will probably be subjected to criticism for aggression from the uncommitted nations

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Document references potential reactions from Latin American countries and the Sino-Soviet Bloc
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: to mitigate any unfavorable reactions from other countries, but also to gain, particularly in Latin America, increasing appreciation of the threat of Castro/Communist Cuba

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: U.S. policy objectives regarding Cuba and Soviet involvement
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Removal of remaining Soviet forces from Cuba

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Document discusses negotiations with Fidel Castro regarding American prisoners
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Mr. Donovan's imminent negotiation with Fidel Castro for freeing the 20-odd American prisoners

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Document discusses diplomatic strategy regarding Cuba and Soviet bloc
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: At the termination of the U. S. Chefs of Mission Conference in El Salvador on January 28-30, Assistant Secretary Martin will visit the Presidents of Chile, Mexico and Brazil to convey the importance President Kennedy attaches to maintaining hemispheric solidarity by supporting the following resolutions

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Strategies to isolate Cuba internationally
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: We will request that NATO include Cuba on the list of countries to which shipment of COCOM list (strategic) items is prohibited

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: References Soviet concerns about U.S. actions in the hemisphere
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Soviet actions that threaten the peace or security of the hemisphere. This does not preclude appropriate U.S. retaliation for hostile acts by the Castro Communist or Soviet forces.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Potential international political reactions to U.S. actions
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: It is difficult to predict the reaction of the Latin American governments. They may attack the U.S. for 'intervening' or they may react favorably (as they did during the missile crisis).

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Reference to Sino-Soviet Bloc and potential international implications
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: From the standpoint of military posture, the more active approach may be subjected to counteractions from the Sino-Soviet Bloc elsewhere.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: US policy statement indicates ongoing tensions with Communist Cuba
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: We shall neither initiate nor permit aggression in this hemisphere.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Detailed US objectives regarding Cuba and Soviet influence
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Removing remaining Soviet forces from Cuba

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: US goal to break Cuban ties with Communist bloc
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Encouraging and supporting any developments within Cuba that offer the possibility of replacing the Cuban Government with a regime that would break with the Sino-Soviet Bloc

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Focus on internal Cuban regime destabilization through exile groups
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Support the efforts of certain Cuban exiles, who are associated with the original aims of the 26 of July Movement and who believe that the Castro regime can be overthrown from within

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Negotiations related to American prisoners
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Results of Mr. Donovan's imminent negotiations with Fidel Castro for freeing the 20-odd American prisoners

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Discussion of US diplomatic efforts regarding Cuba and Soviet bloc
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: At the termination of the U. S. Chiefs of Mission Conference... Assistant Secretary Martin, or another representative of the President will visit the Presidents of Chile, Mexico and Brazil to convey the importance President Kennedy attaches to maintaining hemispheric solidarity

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Document discusses diplomatic actions regarding Cuba through OAS and NATO
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: After obtaining the maximum possible support of the key countries of Mexico, Chile and Brazil, the other OAS members will be approached in Washington and in their respective capitals, simultaneously.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Discusses potential multilateral and bilateral political and economic measures against Cuba
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Our contingency planning... should include preparations for increased multilateral and/or bilateral political and economic measures, large scale use of Cubans who are now inside Cuba

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Discussion of potential U.S. military actions against Cuba, including involvement of free Cubans and Latin American nations
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: U.S. military forces employed against Cuba should be accompanied by U.S. militarily-trained free Cubans and by the armed forces of those Latin American nations desirous of participating in the U.S. effort.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: U.S. strategic objectives regarding Cuba and Soviet influence
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Removal of remaining Soviet forces from Cuba

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Proposed actions against Cuban officials and infrastructure
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: ment of Cuban officials in other countries; severance of communications to Cuba; major acts of sabotage on shipping destined for Cuba and on key installations in Cuba; intensive naval patrols

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Multiple policy documents related to Cuba and Cuban Brigade
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: United States Policy Toward the Cuban Brigade

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: U.S. objectives focused on reducing Castro regime's capabilities and supporting potential internal opposition
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Reducing the capabilities of the Castro regime to direct and support subversion and insurrection within the other OAS states

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Strategies for supporting Cuban exiles against Castro regime
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Support the efforts of certain Cuban exiles, who are associated with the original aims of the 26 of July Movement and who believe that the Castro regime can be overthrown

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Document discusses negotiations with Fidel Castro regarding American prisoners
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Mr. Donovan's imminent negotiations with Fidel Castro for freeing the 20-odd American prisoners

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Discussion of diplomatic strategy regarding Cuba and Soviet Bloc
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: At the termination of the U. S. Chiefs of Mission Conference... Assistant Secretary Martin... will visit the Presidents of Chile, Mexico and Brazil to convey the importance President Kennedy attaches to maintaining hemispheric solidarity

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Document discusses OAS (Organization of American States) actions regarding Cuba
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: prohibition of ships of OAS member states from transporting embargoed items and deny use of ports to ships in Bloc-Cuba trade

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Document discusses U.S. policy towards Cuba in the Organization of American States (OAS)
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: With the conclusion of the U.S.-Soviet talks in New York, the Cuban problem reverts to the OAS context.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Diplomatic strategy regarding Soviet and Cuban relations
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: denial of overflights and transit rights to Soviet aircraft on Bloc-Cuba runs

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Document discusses Cuban resistance and potential refugee impacts
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: politico-psychological value as a symbol of Cuban resistance to Castro/Communism may more than compensate for its limited military utility.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: DOD program for Cuban military refugees and potential invasion preparation
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Individual Cubans could continue to be accepted for service in the U. S. Armed Forces and their language, skill and country knowledge could be distributed through various U. S. units which might be used in an invasion.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Document outlines U.S. strategic objectives regarding Cuba
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: to unseat the Castro regime, and would lend weight to arguments that the U.S. may be leaning toward coexistence with the Castro regime.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Multiple topics related to Cuban missile crisis aftermath and US policy
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: 1. Verification of withdrawal of missiles. 2. Removal of Soviet troops from Cuba.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Analysis of Cuban-Soviet relations from Italian Embassy report
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: The possibility that there will soon be a loosening of the political and economic ties with the USSR appears to me to be nil at this time.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Insights into Cuba's international diplomatic stance
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: The Chinese Ambassador to Habana will have done everything possible to convince Castro to resist (and in fact the latter held firm on the question of inspection).

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Discussion of Castro's relations with USSR and potential political changes
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: In substance Castro, even if he cannot exactly be defined as pro-Khrushchev, is tied to the USSR in such a way that he cannot for any reason release himself.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Analysis of Cuban situation and potential revolutionary dynamics
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: In conclusion, in judging the Cuban situation it is necessary first to keep in mind the personality and temperament of Fidel Castro, the influence which he has on a part of the population, and finally his deep-rooted hate of the United States.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Discussion of Cuban-Soviet relations and potential geopolitical implications
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: ...when Castro will tried for the solution of the problem - one can hope for a perhaps not too distant day... the USSR is obliged to feed Castro to permit his survival...

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Mention of discussions with a member of Castro's military about acquiring weapons
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: I had overheard that discussions were going on with a member of Castro's military but that he wanted, as I recall, he wanted some British -- I mean Belgian rifles and

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Mention of activities in Paris, potentially involving intelligence gathering
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: We had just moved the Station at that time, in Paris, out of the Embassy into the old Rothschild Palace, and we felt that it was probably bugged, so all conversations took place -- we walked around the garden and that type of thing

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Detailed description of US efforts to disrupt Cuban industry and trade
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: Cuban industry was totally U.S.-oriented. As parts began wearing out and this type of thing, Castro had his little people there running around trying to place orders with subsidiaries of U.S. companies.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Discussion of Cuban oil economy and Bright Stock oil purchase
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: 85 percent of her energy comes from oil, this was considered a critical commodity. Bright Stock can be -- oh, it is almost like tar, melted tar, and it can be cut into additives, lubricants

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Discussion of radio broadcasts targeting Cuba and Havana
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: The intent was to get world opinion against Castro. You don't do that by publishing in the United States.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Mention of Castro agent infiltration and intelligence gathering
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: We had identified a Castro agent that came in by small boat and when she hit the -- they had a reception center up in Opa Loca that was really a HEW operation

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Mention of revolutionary fronts run by Cuban exiles reporting suspicious activities
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: in those days when we had formed these revolutionary fronts, they were reporting to Case Officers and they would report on things in the community, of people they thought were suspect

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Discussion of Cuban community intelligence activities in Miami
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: One of the big problems we had was within that Cuban community, as I said earlier, were some of the militant anti-Castro groups and this just drove the FBI and the Coast Guard and Customs and in general the law enforcement US. Government

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Details of Cuban government infiltration methods
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: The Cuban Government. They couldn't do it very well on the airlift because, as I said before, the aged, infirm, and young, but they did infiltrate them by small boat.

FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.description: Detailed electronic surveillance of Cuban communication networks
FOREIGN_GOVERNMENT_REACTIONS.quote: NSA tasks them with the frequencies they wanted covered and the Cuban Communications nets they wanted covered, such as the border guards.

US_POLICY_CUBA.description: Secret memorandum detailing US policy towards Cuba in January 1963
US_POLICY_CUBA.quote: On November 20, the President set forth the broad guidelines of United States policy with respect to Cuba

US_POLICY_CUBA.quote: Our ultimate objective with respect to Cuba is the overthrow of the Castro/Communist regime and its replacement with one compatible with the objectives of the U.S.

US_POLICY_CUBA.description: Secret memorandum outlining US policy towards Cuba in early 1963
US_POLICY_CUBA.quote: We will not, of course, abandon the political, economic and other efforts of this hemisphere to halt subversion from Cuba, nor our purpose and hope that the Cuban people shall some day be truly free.

US_POLICY_CUBA.description: Secret document outlining US objectives regarding Cuba and the Castro regime
US_POLICY_CUBA.quote: being understood that our ultimate objective is replacement of the regime by one fully compatible with the goals of the United States

US_CUBA_POLICY.description: Detailed US policy objectives regarding Cuba during Cold War period
US_CUBA_POLICY.quote: Objectives of United States policy with respect to Cuba are:

US_CUBA_POLICY.description: Top Secret document discussing US policy toward Cuba and the Castro regime
US_CUBA_POLICY.quote: Commitment to this course of action does not exclude the possibility of actively pursuing the isolation of the Castro regime from the Bloc.

US_CUBA_POLICY.description: Top secret memorandum outlining US policy toward Cuba in early 1963
US_CUBA_POLICY.quote: On November 20, the President set forth the broad guidelines of United States policy with respect to Cuba

US_CUBA_POLICY.description: Secret memorandum detailing US policy towards Cuba in January 1963
US_CUBA_POLICY.quote: As for our part, if all offensive weapons systems are removed from Cuba and kept out of the hemisphere in the future, under adequate verification and safeguards, and if Cuba is not used for the export of aggressive communist purposes, there will be peace in the Caribbean.

US_CUBA_POLICY.description: Secret memorandum detailing US policy towards Cuba in January 1963
US_CUBA_POLICY.quote: As for our part, if all offensive weapons systems are removed from Cuba and kept out of the hemisphere in the future, under adequate verification and safeguards...

US_CUBA_POLICY.description: Detailed US policy objectives regarding Cuba during Cold War period
US_CUBA_POLICY.quote: Objectives of United States policy with respect to Cuba are:

REGIME_CHANGE.description: US objective to potentially replace Cuban government
REGIME_CHANGE.quote: Encouraging and supporting any developments within Cuba that offer the possibility of replacing the Cuban Government with a regime that would break with the Sino-Soviet Bloc

REGIME_CHANGE.description: US government recommending policy to overthrow Castro/Communist regime
REGIME_CHANGE.quote: The objectives stated in the Coordinator's paper do not sufficiently commit the U. S. to the overthrow of the Castro/Communist regime.

REGIME_CHANGE.description: US explicitly states goal of potentially replacing Cuban government
REGIME_CHANGE.quote: Encouraging and supporting any developments within Cuba that offer the possibility of replacing the Cuban Government with a regime that would break with the Sino-Soviet Bloc

CIA_ACTIVITIES.description: Detailed covert action plan against Castro government
CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: course of action would involve a broad gamut of carefully timed political, economic, psychological and covert actions

CIA_ACTIVITIES.description: Outlines covert action strategies against Cuba
CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: Isolating, undermining and interacting with Castro/Communist regime through feasible diplomatic, economic, covert actions may achieve the immediate objectives

CIA_ACTIVITIES.description: Detailed covert program targeting Cuba, including intelligence collection, recruitment of Cuban officials, and propaganda infiltration
CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: In addition to current covert program, such as intelligence collection, recruitment of Cuban officials as agents, radio broadcasts, support of the Cuban Revolutionary Council (CRC) and other exile group activities and infiltration of propaganda materials

CIA_ACTIVITIES.description: Secret document detailing covert operations against Cuba
CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: Assist Cuban exiles in developing a capability to launch balloons carrying leaflets and other propaganda materials from international waters into Cuba

CIA_ACTIVITIES.description: Secret document outlining covert operations against Cuba
CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: In addition to current covert program, such as intelligence collection, recruitment of Cuban officials as agents, radio broadcasts, support of the Cuban Revolutionary Council(CRC) and other exile group activities and infiltration of propaganda materials

CIA_ACTIVITIES.description: Deposition of a CIA employee related to anti-Castro activities and clandestine operations
CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote:
DOCUMENT TYPE: DEPOSITION
SUBJECTS: ANTI-CASTRO ACTIVITIES, CIA, CLANDESTINE OPERATIONS

CIA_ACTIVITIES.description: Discussion of CIA paramilitary operations against Cuba
CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: Maritime operations

CIA_ACTIVITIES.description: Timeline of covert Cuban operations
CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: I think these operations were probably at their height during the period about 1963 through, say, 1967. The program was terminated in 1968, I think in December 1968

CIA_ACTIVITIES.description: Discussion of CIA covert operations in Cuba, including infiltrations, exfiltrations, and sabotage
CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: the classical operations that we did in the maritime activities were the infiltrations and exfiltrations.

CIA_ACTIVITIES.description: Detailed description of sabotage operations against Cuba
CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: We did lay down a cache, if you will, sabotage kits to be used by our own island agents. They contained sugar to dump into gas tanks and metal fragments to put down crank cases.

CIA_ACTIVITIES.description: Discussion of CIA sponsorship of Cuban revolutionary fronts in southern United States in 1963
CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: The Agency subsidized these fronts in an effort to have unity rather than these split factions, split anti-Castro factions.

CIA_ACTIVITIES.description: Discussion of CIA involvement with Cuban exiles
CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: There have been some allegations in the press and elsewhere about possible misuse of Cuban exiles, members of that community, by the CIA.

CIA_ACTIVITIES.description: Secret document discussing objective related to Guatemala City and Cuban insurgency forces
CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: OBJECTIVE OF COURSE, IS TO BREAK UP GUAT INSURGENCY FORCES AND NEGATE ANY CUBAN EXPORT WHILE, AT SAME TIME DESIRE PANICS MACHINES TO EXPOSE HARD AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE WITHIN FEASIBLE DENIABILITY LYING-O-3

CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: Therefore, please submit the CIA's official initial Statement of Compliance to the Review Board as soon as possible, but no later than March 16, 1998.

CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: Collection (consisting of CIA officer Russ Holmes' working files relating to the Kennedy assassination) into the JFK Collection

CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: In a 15 July 1998 memo to CIA General Counsel, the JFK Assassination Records Review Board outlined what it expects will be contained in CIA's Final Declaration of Compliance

CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: The CIA will complete its review and recommendations for release of the major record categories listed above no later than April 30, 1999.

CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: SS would like to have a durable, permanent cover established for Thomas B. CASASIN as quickly as possible

CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: It was planned to use Subject in a test assignment at the Afro-Asian Journalists' Conference and the PE World Youth Festival, both in Algeria during summer 1965

CIA_ACTIVITIES.description: Covert plans for coup against Costa Rican government
CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: Southern Nicaragua is to be used by the Somoza/Scheck forces as a launching site for a coup against the government of Costa Rica.
