CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: COORDINATION OF ACSI OP INTO CUBA INVOLVING USE OF ANTONIO CUESTA, CRAFT OWNED BY HIM

CIA_ACTIVITIES.description: Discussion of CIA clandestine intelligence collection methods and potential operational risks
CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: Clandestine activities should be assessed not only in the context of their relationship to an open activity but also in the context of their relationship to United States foreign policy.

CIA_ACTIVITIES.description: Detailed section on CIA operations and personnel in foreign countries
CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: Leading functionalities of the CIA in the country: its office. Plans and objectives, it pursues in Santo Domingo.

CIA_ACTIVITIES.description: Document details CIA employee's activities in Cuba and Guatemala
CIA_ACTIVITIES.quote: In May 1960 Subject was certified to the State Department in connection with ninety day proposed TDY in Havana, Cuba with JMARC; and in October 1960 she was transferred from Havana to Guatemala.

CONTINGENCY_PLANNING.description: Secret document outlining US contingency plans against Cuba and Castro regime
CONTINGENCY_PLANNING.quote: Our contingency planning, which will be undertaken immediately, should include preparations for increased multilateral and/or bilateral political and economic measures, large scale use of Cubans who are now inside Cuba

CONTINGENCY_PLANNING.description: Secret document discussing contingency planning for Cuba, including potential actions against Castro regime
CONTINGENCY_PLANNING.quote: Contingency Planning: New opportunities for accomplishing our objectives may arise either as a result of Bloc action in other parts of the world; as a result of aggressive moves (or isolated hostile actions) by the Castro-Communist regime itself; or as a result of uprisings or internal conflict within Cuba.

CONTINGENCY_PLANNING.description: Detailed contingency planning for potential scenarios involving Cuba
CONTINGENCY_PLANNING.quote: Our contingency planning, which will be undertaken immediately, should include preparations for increased multilateral and/or bilateral political and economic measures, large scale use of Cubans who are not inside Cuba; more extensive air activity

BRIGADE_OPERATIONS.description: Discussion of Brigade members (likely Cuban exile group) and strategy for their integration
BRIGADE_OPERATIONS.quote: Our programs should be designed to encourage the Brigade members to melt back into the exile community and engage in constructive pursuits pending the liberation of Cuba.

BRIGADE_OPERATIONS.description: Recommendation to disband a military brigade and integrate members into existing U.S. military programs
BRIGADE_OPERATIONS.quote: The Brigade should be disbanded as a military unit and individual members urged to accept civilian training or to enlist in the existing U.S. military program for Cubans and join a Brigade reserve unit thereafter.

BRIGADE_OPERATIONS.description: Recommendation to disband a Brigade military unit and reintegrate members into civilian or U.S. military programs
BRIGADE_OPERATIONS.quote: The Brigade should be disbanded as a military unit and individual members urged to accept civilian training or to enlist in the existing U.S. military program for Cubans and join a Brigade reserve unit thereafter.

BRIGADE_OPERATIONS.description: Discussion of Brigade members in exile and potential reintegration strategy
BRIGADE_OPERATIONS.quote: Our programs should be designed to encourage the Brigade members to melt back into the exile community and engage in constructive pursuits pending the liberation of Cuba.

U.S_POLICY_OBJECTIVES.description: Secret document outlining U.S. policy objectives regarding Cuba in 1963
U.S_POLICY_OBJECTIVES.quote: U.S. Policy Objectives: The following are the objectives of the U.S. with respect to Cuba:

CIA_FOREIGN_POLICY.description: Specific policy goals targeting Castro regime and Soviet influence
CIA_FOREIGN_POLICY.quote: Reducing the capabilities of the Castro regime to direct and support subversion and insurrection within the other OAS states

CIA_FOREIGN_POLICY.description: Secret document outlining U.S. policy objectives regarding Cuba and the Castro regime
CIA_FOREIGN_POLICY.quote: being understood that our ultimate objective is replacement of the regime by one fully compatible with the goals of the United States

CIA_FOREIGN_POLICY.description: Top secret document outlining US strategy for undermining Castro's Communist regime in Cuba
CIA_FOREIGN_POLICY.quote: Isolating, undermining and discrediting the Castro/Communist regime through the exercise of all feasible diplomatic, economic, psychological and covert actions

CIA_FOREIGN_POLICY.description: Secret document detailing US strategy against Cuba, focusing on economic and shipping restrictions
CIA_FOREIGN_POLICY.quote: to get agreement from Free World Industrial nations to prevent shipping of critical spare parts and equipment to Cuba, not on the COCOM list.

COLD_WAR_STRATEGY.description: Objectives focused on preventing Soviet military presence in Cuba
COLD_WAR_STRATEGY.quote: Removal of remaining Soviet forces from Cuba

GEOPOLITICAL_STRATEGY.description: Detailed objectives for isolating and undermining the Castro regime
GEOPOLITICAL_STRATEGY.quote: Maximizing the political isolation of the Castro regime from other Free World states, and especially from states of the OAS

EXILE_COMMUNITY_DYNAMICS.description: Concern about creating a privileged class in the exile community
EXILE_COMMUNITY_DYNAMICS.quote: Our moral obligation would be discharged to the Brigade members and creation of a privileged class in the exile community would be avoided.

EXILE_COMMUNITY_DYNAMICS.description: Concern about creating a privileged class within the exile community
EXILE_COMMUNITY_DYNAMICS.quote: Our moral obligation would be discharged to the Brigade members and creation of a privileged class in the exile community would be avoided.

HISTORICAL_CONTEXT.description: Top Secret memo from Deputy Secretary of Defense regarding US Policy Toward Cuba in January 1963

CIA_FOREIGN_OPERATIONS.description: Secret document outlining U.S. government plan to overthrow Castro/Communist regime in Cuba
CIA_FOREIGN_OPERATIONS.quote: Our ultimate objective with respect to Cuba remains the overthrow of the Castro/Communist regime and its replacement by one compatible with the objective of the Free World.

CIA_FOREIGN_OPERATIONS.description: Detailed U.S. government plan to overthrow Castro/Communist regime in Cuba
CIA_FOREIGN_OPERATIONS.quote: Our ultimate objective with respect to Cuba remains the overthrow of the Castro/Communist regime and its replacement by one compatible with the Free World.

CIA_FOREIGN_OPERATIONS.description: Discussion of Cuban operations and potential assassination attempts against Fidel Castro
CIA_FOREIGN_OPERATIONS.quote: In the course of your activities with respect to Cuba, did you ever learn of any such attempts?

CIA_FOREIGN_OPERATIONS.description: Discussion of CIA's contingency plans for Cuban intelligence organization in exile
CIA_FOREIGN_OPERATIONS.quote: We full intended -- this was part of the overall contingency plan that US Government had. Should Castro ever be overthrown, these people would be the nucleus to go into Cuba and form a new Ministry of the Interior.

COVERT_ACTIONS.description: Detailed supporting actions for Cuba destabilization plan
COVERT_ACTIONS.quote: The following actions should be initiated in the sequence set forth below:

US_FOREIGN_POLICY.description: Top secret memorandum detailing US policy toward Cuba in 1963
US_FOREIGN_POLICY.quote: Our ultimate objective with respect to Cuba remains the overthrow of the Castro/Communist regime and its replacement by one compatible with the objectives of the U. S.

US_FOREIGN_POLICY.description: Detailed US policy document about overthrowing the Castro/Communist regime in Cuba
US_FOREIGN_POLICY.quote: The ultimate objective is the overthrow of the Castro/Communist regime is replacement by one more compatible with the objectives of the U.S.

US_FOREIGN_POLICY.description: Discussion of future policy towards Cuban Brigade and trained Cuban militants
US_FOREIGN_POLICY.quote: A decision on the future of the Cuban Brigade and other Cubans trained militarily by the U.S. must logically proceed from whatever over all policy the U.S. adopts toward Cuba.

GOVT_STRATEGIES.description: Detailed policy of pressuring Castro regime
GOVT_STRATEGIES.quote: The U. S. Government will apply increasing degrees of political, economic, psychological and military pressures

MILITARY_INTERVENTION.description: Detailed plans for potential military support to anti-Castro groups
MILITARY_INTERVENTION.quote: We should be in a position to respond with open military support (to include such items as material, advisors, training, and Special Forces support and, if necessary, up to the full range of military forces)

FOREIGN_POLICY_LIMITATIONS.description: Conditions for potential US invasion of Cuba
FOREIGN_POLICY_LIMITATIONS.quote: Invasion of U.S. military forces... should not be undertaken in the absence of aggression or other Castro/Communist and/or Soviet actions that threaten the peace or security of the hemisphere

U.S. MILITARY_OPERATIONS.description: Document outlines U.S. military strategy against Cuba
U.S. MILITARY_OPERATIONS.quote: U.S. military forces employed against Cuba should be accompanied by U.S. militarily-trained free Cubans and by the armed forces of those Latin American nations desirous of participating in the U.S. effort.

INTELLIGENCE_GATHERING.description: Emphasizes comprehensive intelligence collection on Cuba
INTELLIGENCE_GATHERING.quote: Intensive, comprehensive and continuing intelligence gathering in depth on Cuba should be identified as a primary objective of the national intelligence effort.

INTELLIGENCE_GATHERING.description: Organization staffed primarily by Cubans with minimal external oversight
INTELLIGENCE_GATHERING.quote: all these people were Cuban with the exception of we had what we call an On-Site Case Officer, who was a fulltime staff employee and he had a couple of assistants, including a secretary

INTELLIGENCE_GATHERING.description: Discussion of intelligence collection activities by LASER (Latin American Social and Economic Research) group
INTELLIGENCE_GATHERING.quote: They compiled dossiers on the principals inside Cuba. They carded -- they kept card files on every refugee that came through the reception center.

MULTILATERAL_STRATEGY.description: Preference for multilateral approach in actions against Cuba
MULTILATERAL_STRATEGY.quote: Whenever possible, U.S. actions against Cuba should be multilateral, preferably based upon the Treaty of Reciprocal Assistance (Rio Pact) or on resolutions adopted by the Organization of American States.

NATIONAL_SECURITY.description: Primary objective of protecting US and OAS security
NATIONAL_SECURITY.quote: Protecting the security of the United States and the other states of the Organization of American States (OAS) by assuring that offensive weapons are not reintroduced into Cuba

DIPLOMATIC_STRATEGY.description: Planned diplomatic, economic, and psychological pressure tactics against Cuba
DIPLOMATIC_STRATEGY.quote: The U.S. Government will be prepared to apply increasing degrees of political, economic, psychological and military pressures

MARITIME_RESTRICTIONS.description: Comprehensive maritime blockade plan against Cuba
MARITIME_RESTRICTIONS.quote: close United States ports to all vessels of a country whose vessels engage in carrying arms to Cuba

CIA_COVERT_OPERATIONS.description: Secret document detailing CIA plans for Cuban exiles
CIA_COVERT_OPERATIONS.quote: Assist Cuban exiles in developing a capability to launch balloons carrying leaflets and other propaganda materials from international waters into Cuba.

CIA_COVERT_OPERATIONS.description: Detailed plans for covert activities targeting Cuba, including intelligence collection, recruitment, and propaganda infiltration
CIA_COVERT_OPERATIONS.quote: In addition to current covert program, such as intelligence collection, recruitment of Cuban officials as agents, radio broadcasts, support of Cuban Revolutionary Council (CRC) and other exile group activities and infiltration of propaganda materials

CIA_COVERT_OPERATIONS.description: Secret document detailing covert intelligence and operational plans against Cuba
CIA_COVERT_OPERATIONS.quote: intensified covert collection of intelligence within Cuba, especially within the regime

CIA_COVERT_OPERATIONS.description: Secret document outlining U.S. government objectives against Castro regime
CIA_COVERT_OPERATIONS.quote: Maximizing the cost to the Soviet Union of supporting the Castro regime

MILITARY_OPERATIONS.description: Potential military support for anti-Castro groups
MILITARY_OPERATIONS.quote: We should be in a position to respond with open military support (to include such items as material, advisors, training, and special forces support)

CUBAN_EXILE_OPERATIONS.description: Strategic support for Cuban exiles aimed at overthrowing Castro regime
CUBAN_EXILE_OPERATIONS.quote: Support the efforts of certain Cuban exiles, who are associated with the original aims of the 26 of July Movement and who believe that the Castro regime can be overthrown from within

CUBAN_EXILE_OPERATIONS.description: Subject's father was involved in anti-Castro Cuban exile activities
CUBAN_EXILE_OPERATIONS.quote: Was a former Cuban Senator and leader of a graded private army of Batista enforcers called 'Los Tigres(The Tigers)'

DIPLOMATIC_NEGOTIATIONS.description: Negotiation efforts for releasing American prisoners with Fidel Castro
DIPLOMATIC_NEGOTIATIONS.quote: Await results of Mr. Donovan's imminent negotiations with Fidel Castro for freeing the 20-odd American prisoners.

INTERNATIONAL_RELATIONS.description: Planned shipping blockade and international coordination against Cuba
INTERNATIONAL_RELATIONS.quote: Inform NATO and OAS twelve hours in advance of the proclamation of the four point shipping orders.

US_CUBA_RELATIONS.description: Document outlines trade and shipping restrictions against Cuba
US_CUBA_RELATIONS.quote: close United States ports to any ship which has carried goods in the bloc-Cuba trade within 120 days of the time it seeks to enter a United States port;

TRADE_RESTRICTIONS.description: Comprehensive shipping and trade prohibition for US flag ships and ships owned by US nationals
TRADE_RESTRICTIONS.quote: prohibit all United States flag ships and all ships owned by United States nationals or residents from entering any ports of Cuba and from carrying any goods bound to or from Cuba; and

U.S._MILITARY_OPERATIONS.description: Detailed plan for potential military intervention in Cuba
U.S._MILITARY_OPERATIONS.quote: ultimately, the use of U.S. military force. To the extent feasible, U.S. military forces employed against Cuba should be accompanied by U.S. militarily-trained free Cubans and by the armed forces of those Latin American nations desirous of participating in the U.S. effort.

U.S._POLICY_CUBA.description: Secret National Security Council memorandum outlining U.S. policy objectives regarding Cuba in January 1963
U.S._POLICY_CUBA.quote: Protecting the security of the United States and the other states of the Organization of American States by assuring that offensive weapons are not reintroduced into Cuba

FOREIGN_POLICY.description: Objectives include politically isolating Cuba and maximizing cost to Soviet Union
FOREIGN_POLICY.quote: Maximizing the political isolation of the Castro regime from other Free World states, and especially from states of the OAS
Maximizing the political isolation of the Castro regime from other free world states, and especially from states of the OAS

MILITARY_CONTINGENCY.description: Preparation for potential military contingencies against Cuba
MILITARY_CONTINGENCY.quote: Being prepared to meet, with the employment of appropriate U.S. combat elements and/or logistical support, the wide variety of military contingencies that may arise

CUBAN_EXILE_ACTIVITIES.description: Support for Cuban exiles seeking to restore the 26 of July Movement's original aims
CUBAN_EXILE_ACTIVITIES.quote: support of Cuban exiles who are seeking to return the 26 of July Movement to its original aims

CUBAN_EXILE_ACTIVITIES.description: Discussion of Cuban exiles' perceptions of CIA involvement in anti-Castro activities
CUBAN_EXILE_ACTIVITIES.quote: large numbers of Cuban exiles, Cuban people in the southern United States, talked about and believed that they were involved in the CIA sponsored activities

POLITICAL_CONTEXT.description: US commitment to halt Cuban subversion while avoiding military invasion
POLITICAL_CONTEXT.quote: We will not... abandon the political, economic and other efforts of this hemisphere to halt subversion from Cuba, nor our purpose and hope that the Cuban people shall some day be truly free.

FOREIGN_INTERVENTION.description: Comprehensive objectives for controlling Cuban military and diplomatic actions
FOREIGN_INTERVENTION.quote: Preventing Cuba from taking any aggressive military action against other Caribbean states

MILITARY_PLANNING.quote: Being prepared to meet, with the employment of appropriate U.S. combat elements and/or logistical support, the wide variety of military contingencies that may arise

PROPAGANDA_OPERATIONS.description: Detailed propaganda distribution plan using balloons
PROPAGANDA_OPERATIONS.quote: Assist Cuban exiles in developing a capability to launch balloons carrying leaflets and other propaganda materials from international waters into Cuba

PROPAGANDA_OPERATIONS.description: Document discusses propaganda efforts through AMCARBON-1 defection story
PROPAGANDA_OPERATIONS.quote: AMCARBON-1 has been used successfully, during the period covered by this report, as a propaganda outlet through which items of interest to KUBARK could be surfaced in the free world press.

CUBA_OPERATIONS.description: Detailed contingency planning for operations against Cuba and Castro regime
CUBA_OPERATIONS.quote: New opportunities for accomplishing our objectives may arise either as a result of Bloc action in other parts of the world; as a result of aggressive moves (or isolated hostile actions) by the Castro-Communist regime itself; or as a result of uprisings or internal conflict within Cuba.

CUBA_OPERATIONS.description: Discussion of economic warfare and efforts against Castro's Cuba
CUBA_OPERATIONS.quote: We were talking about economic warfare. We have talked about attempts to keep the price of sugar low. What other types of economic activities were conducted against Castro's Cuba?

CUBA_OPERATIONS.description: Specific operation targeting Cuban Maritime fleet using Nordberg engines
CUBA_OPERATIONS.quote: The Cubans were having an awful time with their Maritime fleet, such as it was. These boats were powered with Nordberg engines. We simply went to the Nordberg people and told them -- asked them to cooperate with us.

CUBA_OPERATIONS.description: Specific mention of operations related to Cuba
CUBA_OPERATIONS.quote: ...no way did he ever participate in any three or 400 active operations into Cuba.

CUBA_OPERATIONS.description: Hunt's propaganda work focused on Cubans abroad, not within Cuba
Detailed information about intelligence activities related to Cuba
CUBA_OPERATIONS.quote: This operational intelligence was most helpful in terms of keeping JMWAVE informed on AMEND-1's movements. Subsequent developments revealed that AMCARBON-1 could not contact AMEND-1

MILITARY_PREPARATIONS.description: Proposed military and intelligence actions against Cuba
MILITARY_PREPARATIONS.quote: Contingency planning... should include preparations for increased multilateral and/or bilateral political and economic measures, large scale use of Cubans who are now inside Cuba; more extensive air activity including both high and low level flights primarily directed toward surveillance

LATIN_AMERICAN_INVOLVEMENT.description: Proposal to involve Latin American forces in potential Cuba operations
LATIN_AMERICAN_INVOLVEMENT.quote: U.S. military forces should be accompanied by U.S. militarily-trained free Cubans and by the armed forces of those Latin American nations desiring of participating in the U.S. effort.

CUBAN_OPERATIONS.description: Secret memorandum about Cuban Brigade from Bay of Pigs invasion
CUBAN_OPERATIONS.quote: Approximately 1500 Cubans participated in the Bay of Pigs invasion (known as Brigade 2506), the great majority of whom were captured. In December 1962 over 1100 were released.

CUBA_RELATIONS.description: Secret National Security Council memorandum on current problems concerning Cuba

TASK_FORCE_OPERATIONS.description: Discussion of CIA Task Force W focusing on Cuban operations
TASK_FORCE_OPERATIONS.quote: It was the overall Cuban operations.

CIA_STATION_LOCATIONS.description: Miami Station established in Coral Gables around 1960, prior to Bay of Pigs
CIA_STATION_LOCATIONS.quote: Well, I think they had a forward operations base down there about 1960 which was small, in Coral Gables.

DCD_OFFICE_INTERACTIONS.description: Discussion of communication between an individual (Mr. Sturgis) and the DCD office in Miami regarding information sharing
DCD_OFFICE_INTERACTIONS.quote: Mr. Sturgis has been told by the DCD office in Miami to take his information to the Drug Enforcement Agency or the FBI.

AGENCY_STRUCTURE.description: Describes operational structure of CIA maritime missions
AGENCY_STRUCTURE.quote: He had an assigned crew and every boat had a Case Officer operating either out of the -- probably out of the Miami Station.

CIA_FACILITIES.description: Confirmation of CIA Miami Station and Key West base
CIA_FACILITIES.quote: We had activities down in the Keys also. I said, we did have a Key West base.

CIA_PERSONNEL_OPERATIONS.description: Discussion of CIA involvement with paramilitary training of Cuban operatives
CIA_PERSONNEL_OPERATIONS.quote: We trained them at these places we had in the Keys. Now, there also -- some of them were brought up here and trained at the Domestic Training Station.

CIA_PERSONNEL_OPERATIONS.description: Internal document discussing conversion of an agent named Casasin to career agent status
CIA_PERSONNEL_OPERATIONS.quote: FOLLOWING IS STATUS REPORT ON TALKS WITH CASASIN RE CONVERSION TO CAREER AGENT

PARAMILITARY_TRAINING.description: UDT (Underwater Demolition Team) training facilities mentioned
PARAMILITARY_TRAINING.quote: We did have training facilities for the UDT teams.

PARAMILITARY_OPERATIONS.description: Discussion of Special Operations Group (SOG) conducting paramilitary training with Cuban refugees
PARAMILITARY_OPERATIONS.quote: Most of the paramilitary operations and the training was conducted by the Special Operations Group

PARAMILITARY_OPERATIONS.description: Detailed coordination of complex paramilitary operations involving multiple government agencies
PARAMILITARY_OPERATIONS.quote: These operations had to be planned well in advance because the tides had to be right, the moon had to be in the proper phase for communications and this type of thing. And these things, all these were coordinated with the Joint Chiefs of Staff, the Navy, the Coast Guard, the FBI.

PARAMILITARY_OPERATIONS.description: Discussion of a paramilitary naval operation based in Miami with extensive equipment
PARAMILITARY_OPERATIONS.quote: We had -- honestly, everything from a canoe up to three to 500 foot mother ship. We had Boston whalers, rubber boats.

CUBAN_REFUGEE_OPERATIONS.description: Confirmation that Cuban refugees were being trained at special facilities
CUBAN_REFUGEE_OPERATIONS.quote: Now, were the people that were being trained at these facilities basically Cuban refugees? Yes.

EXTRA_LEGAL_ACTIVITIES.description: Acknowledgment of covert operations against Castro
EXTRA_LEGAL_ACTIVITIES.quote: Well, the people that would be knowledgeable are probably retired and I was running the program.

CIA_FUNDING_METHODS.description: Indicates Radio Swan was fully funded by the CIA without public fundraising
CIA_FUNDING_METHODS.quote: Radio Swan and this type of thing was fully subsidized by the Agency.

ECONOMIC_WARFARE.description: Discussion of economic warfare tactics against Cuba involving American business firms
ECONOMIC_WARFARE.quote: We enlisted everybody's support that we could.

GOVT_SANCTIONS.description: Explanation of trade restrictions with Cuba
GOVT_SANCTIONS.quote: Well, in the first place, they couldn't trade with Cuba. They couldn't get export licenses from this country anyway. Then, under the Foreign Assets Control Act...

BAY_OF_PIGS.description: Direct reference to Bay of Pigs operation and associated personnel
BAY_OF_PIGS.quote: This, of course, is posted Bay of Pigs

MARITIME_OPERATIONS.description: Discussion of covert maritime operations against Cuba
MARITIME_OPERATIONS.quote: Well, the infiltration operations, infiltrating agents into Cuba, exfiltrating agents, hit and run sabotage raids.

PROGRAM_TERMINATION.quote: First of all, it was too expensive. It wasn't providing enough intelligence and it simply wasn't -- economically

CIA_PARAMILITARY_OPERATIONS.description: Discussion of covert paramilitary operations requiring advance approval from the Forty Committee
CIA_PARAMILITARY_OPERATIONS.quote: Every operation received a specific approval from the Forty Committee.

CIA_PARAMILITARY_OPERATIONS.description: Discussion of CIA paramilitary operations targeting Cuban infrastructure
CIA_PARAMILITARY_OPERATIONS.quote: The thing we wanted to get at was the oil and the automotive machinery on the island. We knew it was breaking down and if we could get a complete breakdown we would have everything at a standstill

COVERT_OPERATIONAL_PROCEDURES.description: Detailed description of operational procedures including agent infiltration and cache placement
COVERT_OPERATIONAL_PROCEDURES.quote: When we infiltrated an agent, Cubans would identify him and capture him.

OPERATIONAL_VOLUME.description: Low volume of sensitive paramilitary operations
OPERATIONAL_VOLUME.quote: I would say that probably at the height of the thing they may be running three or four a month. No more than that.

TRAINING_OPERATIONS.description: Discussion of training exercises and potential sabotage operations
TRAINING_OPERATIONS.quote: Obviously, these guys trained. In order to run one of these operations, you would have to have a mother ship in place and rubber boats and the UDT people to go in to see if there were mines and this type of thing on the shore

TRAINING_OPERATIONS.description: Document discusses plans for REESKIN Agents processing and training
TRAINING_OPERATIONS.quote: SR Division plans to process thirty or thirty-five REESKIN Agents this year. Time is, of course, of the essence, in view of the fact that these people will have to be assessed, security-cleared, briefed, and trained, and arrangements for grants made before the summer season.

SABOTAGE_OPERATIONS.description: Detailed discussion of a specific sabotage mission
SABOTAGE_OPERATIONS.quote: Well, we conducted one hit and run sabotage against the Texaco refinery.

CUBA_SOVIET_RELATIONS.description: Tensions between Cubans and Soviet equipment/support
CUBA_SOVIET_RELATIONS.quote: Cubans didn't like the Soviet equipment because they were used to good American equipment

CIA_OPERATIONAL_COVER.description: Discussion of using commercial companies as cover for covert operations
CIA_OPERATIONAL_COVER.quote: I think we had 100 so cover companies. [...] These are probably what we would call devised facilities. They were probably registered with the State of Florida and they paid taxes and this type of thing, but if one was blown or became known, we just crossed that out of existence and started up a new one.

OPERATIONAL_PERSONNEL.description: Reference to Eugenio Martinez and operational discipline
OPERATIONAL_PERSONNEL.quote: We brought him back and put him under that contract, that retainer, because of the years that he spent under such strict operational discipline down in the Keys.

NON_OFFICIAL_COVER.description: Discussion of a commercial cover operation using Zenith Corporation as a front
NON_OFFICIAL_COVER.quote: It was a commercial cover. It was called -- the first one was called Zenith Corporation and it was set up with a President and Vice President, normal corporate setup.

INTELLIGENCE_INFRASTRUCTURE.description: Explanation of Ministry of Interior's role in foreign intelligence contexts
INTELLIGENCE_INFRASTRUCTURE.quote: Well, in most countries of the world, the Ministry of Interior, unlike ours, is the security force, internal and external

INTELLIGENCE_INFRASTRUCTURE.description: CIA maintained a physical headquarters facility in Miami
INTELLIGENCE_INFRASTRUCTURE.quote: And they actually had a physical facility in Miami which was their headquarters, did they not?

REFUGEE_OPERATIONS.description: Separated refugee groups for security reasons
REFUGEE_OPERATIONS.quote: the only reason we separated the two groups was for security because we had one group housed over here and the smaller group was over here

CIA_INTELLIGENCE_OPERATIONS.description: Discussion of intelligence recruitment targeting Cuban maritime personnel
CIA_INTELLIGENCE_OPERATIONS.quote: we had targets for recruitment. It could range from anything from a first mate, a captain or chief engineer of a Cuban maritime vessel to Fidel.

INTELLIGENCE_METHODOLOGY.description: Detailed approach to target intelligence gathering and psychological profiling
INTELLIGENCE_METHODOLOGY.quote: we would ask that all the information on that individual be assembled so that we could do a complete target study -- habits, you know, everything right down the line. In case of some of the more important ones, of course, we had psychological studies prepared

INTELLIGENCE_METHODOLOGY.description: Systematic approach to tracking personalities and assigning identification numbers
INTELLIGENCE_METHODOLOGY.quote: A relatively small proportion of the total number of personalities indexed by the CS are of active operational interest at any given point in time.

INTELLIGENCE_METHODOLOGY.description: Detailed explanation of how intelligence files are indexed and maintained
INTELLIGENCE_METHODOLOGY.quote: These are normally subjects of extensive reporting and CI investigation, prospective agents and sources, members of groups and organizations of continuing target interest

CUBAN_INTELLIGENCE_SERVICE.quote: Well, the AMOTS were going to be the intelligence service of Cuba?

GEOGRAPHIC_OPERATIONS.description: Confirms records from Latin American Division were centralized, not kept in Miami
GEOGRAPHIC_OPERATIONS.quote: This is a complete -- only the Latin American Division uses this particular system.

LAW_ENFORCEMENT_CONNECTIONS.description: Explicitly states no law enforcement responsibilities for this unit
LAW_ENFORCEMENT_CONNECTIONS.quote: Did the AMOTS have law enforcement responsibilities in the Miami community? A: No. No.

ELECTRONIC_SURVEILLANCE.description: Electronic intercept operations in Florida, specifically Homestead, focused on Cuban communications
ELECTRONIC_SURVEILLANCE.quote: Well, originally they were set up to assist with the commo. for the infiltration. As we phased down the maritime activities, they were made available to intercept Cuban communications.

CIA_LEADERSHIP.description: Details leadership of Special Activities Staff during 1963-1965
CIA_LEADERSHIP.quote: Desmond Fitzgerald [was head of Special Activities Staff]. Dick Helms was the DEP [Deputy Director for Plans]

CUBAN_MOVEMENTS.description: Interviewee unfamiliar with specific Cuban movement activities in New Orleans
CUBAN_MOVEMENTS.quote: No. No. Totally unfamiliar with anything that took place in New Orleans.

MEDIA_RELATIONS.description: Discussion of media interactions with intelligence services, focused on Latin American press connections
MEDIA_RELATIONS.quote: we would put him in contact with the Chiefs of Stations of areas he periodically visited and the Chiefs of Stations would give him background briefings and this type of thing on the developments within a given country.

MEDIA_INTELLIGENCE_COOPERATION.description: Preferential treatment for Miami Herald in intelligence briefings
MEDIA_INTELLIGENCE_COOPERATION.quote: probably the Miami Herald received probably a little more attention than the other papers, principally because it was a large paper and their Latin American editor traveled a great deal throughout the Hemisphere.

INTELLIGENCE_PERSONNEL.description: CIA Case Officer managing intelligence facility
INTELLIGENCE_PERSONNEL.quote: And there was a CIA Case Officer who managed to supervise that facility.

SECRET_SERVICE_OPERATIONS.description: Agency assistance to Secret Service for name tracing during political conventions
SECRET_SERVICE_OPERATIONS.quote: At the request of the Secret Service we conducted name traces on individuals whom the Secret Service wanted traced. These included the employees of all hotels in Miami

MIAMI_STATION.description: Reference to a CIA station in Miami
MIAMI_STATION.quote: Legality of maintaining stations like the Miami Station within this country?

CIA_CUBAN_OPERATIONS.description: Discussion of CIA's use of Cuban community as a resource for operations
CIA_CUBAN_OPERATIONS.quote: the Cuban community is sort of a resource that is occasionally tapped by the CIA for various operations in this country

AGENT_ACTIVITIES.description: Secret Agent Service Record documenting agent dismissal from LINLC-3 project
AGENT_ACTIVITIES.quote: Agent Dismissed By: Leonard S. TKUT. Dismissal effective 1 July 1965

AGENT_ACTIVITIES.description: Multiple agent identities tracked, some going into hiding or seeking asylum
AGENT_ACTIVITIES.quote: Identity-55 and Identity-56 were mentioned briefly as active during the period from December 1961 to April 1962

DISMISSAL_DETAILS.description: Agent self-terminated after failing to maintain contact with station
DISMISSAL_DETAILS.quote: Reason for Dismissal: Agent in effect terminated himself, since he failed to initiate contact with Station after being turned over to TKUT

ADMINISTRATIVE_OPERATIONS.description: CIA-like administrative document discussing covert meeting and potential safehouse rental
ADMINISTRATIVE_OPERATIONS.quote: Rowton asked LIRING/3 to rent a small apartment that they could use as a safehouse, in lieu of Iden A, for the future

IDENTITY_RECORD.description: Identity sheet for Carlos Persabal Marcue from Mexico
IDENTITY_RECORD.quote: Identity A: Carlos X Persabal Marcue

LOCATION_CONTEXT.description: Document mentions connection to subject file with specific reference number
Document references Mexico City and Guatemala City
Personnel location noted as Paris, France
Document relates to Cuba, specifically Havana

INTELLIGENCE_OBJECTIVE.description: Suggests desire to discuss Cuban efforts and intelligence gathering
INTELLIGENCE_OBJECTIVE.quote: OBJECTIVE, OF COURSE, IS TO ASSESS OUR CUBAN EFFORT THERE... DESIRE TO EXPLORE HAND AS WELL AS POSSIBLE WITHIN FEASIBLE ENGAGEGABILITY LIMITS

LOCATION_INFO.description: Citizenship listed as Guatemala City, Guatemala

ADMINISTRATIVE_RECORD.description: Name check and consolidation request for a person named Cubera, Juan
Termination record for individual named Elias Gonzalez, Francisco
ADMINISTRATIVE_RECORD.quote: Subject was terminated without prejudice by ACSI on 17 January 1966

LOCATION_DATA.description: Subject's place of birth is listed as Guatemala
Document references Arlington, VA and Washington, D.C.

DISPATCH_METADATA.description: Secret/TAPOR classified dispatch from Chief of Station in Mexico City to Chief of Western Hemisphere Division

OPERATION_DETAILS.description: Operational review of LIRING-3 operation by Wallace B. ROWTON
OPERATION_DETAILS.quote: Attached is an operational review of the LIRING-3 operation prepared by Wallace B. ROWTON

GENERAL_OBSERVATIONS.description: Appears to be an official document discussing development of a subject's background/history

TRAVEL_RECORDS.description: Secret document tracking travel of individuals from Guatemala to Mexico City
TRAVEL_RECORDS.quote: 18 OCTOBER 1968 VIA TACA FLIGHT 210 FOR MEXICO CITY. THEY ASKED FOR AND RECEIVED ESCORT DIRECTLY FROM PRISON FARM TO AIRPORT.

OPERATIONAL_INTELLIGENCE.description: Secret draft report on Cuban resistance movement organizations
OPERATIONAL_INTELLIGENCE.quote: An internal leader of the Movimiento Recuperacion Revolucionario (MRR) who was infiltrated into Cuba on 29 December 1961, and exfiltrated on 29 March 1962

OPERATIONAL_INTELLIGENCE.description: Document discusses AMCARBON-1's operational intelligence activities from February 1963 to February 1964
OPERATIONAL_INTELLIGENCE.quote: In the period February 1963 to February 1964, AMCARBON-1 has furnished JMWAVE with operational intelligence as outlined below:

REVOLUTIONARY_GROUPS.description: Identified five key clandestine resistance organizations in Cuba
REVOLUTIONARY_GROUPS.quote: Considers only five clandestine resistance organizations in Cuba of national importance: The Directorio Revolucionario Estudiantil (DRE), Movimiento Democratico Cristiano (MDC), Movimiento Revolucionario del Pueblo (MRP), Movimiento Recuperacion Revolucionario (MRR), and the 30th of November

RESISTANCE_GROUPS.description: Existence of Cuban resistance organizations detailed
RESISTANCE_GROUPS.quote: Refugees described the existence of three resistance organizations, allegedly widespread in membership but limited in action.

ORGANIZED_REVOLUTIONARY_GROUPS.quote: A third organization, the Unidad Revolucionario (UR), is reported to be carrying out the sabotage of sugar fields by burning, using a small incendiary device made of gelatin, match heads, potassium permanganate tablets, and glycerine.

FOREIGN_INTELLIGENCE_OPERATIONS.description: Example of problematic CIA recruitment and intelligence gathering
FOREIGN_INTELLIGENCE_OPERATIONS.quote: The record shows that some US employees were recruited when CIA is discovered recruiting in a multiple of circumstances in a friendly country

GEOPOLITICAL_CONTEXT.description: Analysis of Communist paramilitary strategies and global political maneuvering
GEOPOLITICAL_CONTEXT.quote: Communists, when they stimulate paramilitary activity, are doing what the work expects from them; when we do it, we appear to be engaging in unconscionable and compound delinquency by default.

COUNTERREVOLUTIONARY_ORGANIZATIONS.description: Document details counterrevolutionary organizations in Dominican Republic and their connections
COUNTERREVOLUTIONARY_ORGANIZATIONS.quote: Cuban counterrevolutionary organizations which are functioning in Santo Domingo: their leaders, government personnel, especially with people in the new regime who are responsible for establishing such contact.

INTELLIGENCE_OPERATIONS.description: Intelligence organizations and their activities in Santo Domingo
INTELLIGENCE_OPERATIONS.quote: Intelligence organizations functioning in Santo Domingo. Leaders, Elements abroad. Their duties and functions. Activities carried on. Plans and objectives of Dominican Intelligence, principally against Cuba, Trujillista elements still functioning inside this body; duties and functions.

INTELLIGENCE_OPERATIONS.description: Discusses intelligence and communist party penetration training
INTELLIGENCE_OPERATIONS.quote: PROVISION OF INTELLIGENCE AND COMMUNIST PARTY PENETRATION TRAINING TO VIETNAMESE OFFICER PERSONNEL OF NEW SPECIAL BRANCH

POLITICAL_INTELLIGENCE.description: Comprehensive intelligence gathering on political parties and groups
POLITICAL_INTELLIGENCE.quote: Status of the Parties or Political Groups: composition, strength, penetration, factions, leaders, programs, etc.

SITE_DESCRIPTION.description: Detailed location description of a building, appears to be an administrative or government site
SITE_DESCRIPTION.quote: The SUBJECT SITE building is located on a modern middle-class apartment development in east Washington, D.C.

SUBJECT_SITE_DETAILS.description: Secret document describing a subject site building location details
SUBJECT_SITE_DETAILS.quote: SUBJECT SITE is located on the ground level of the SUBJECT SITE building. Two elevators are located at the rear, or 'lobby' and a stairway to all floors of SUBJECT SITE building is located at the extreme east end of the east wing.

SECURITY_CONSIDERATIONS.quote: SUBJECT SITE building is located on the ground floor... SUBJECT SITE: warns are ground level. Visual and technical penetration may be possible from the land area surrounding SUBJECT SITE building and parking lot

SUBJECT_INFORMATION.description: Document involves Jorge Raul Roblejo, associated with political prisoners
SUBJECT_INFORMATION.quote: SUBJECTS: MR. LORIE, JORGE RAUL ROBLEJO, RES, POLIT ACT, TRA, ASSOC, POLIT PRISONERS

COMMUNIST_ACTIVITIES.description: Document describes Communist activities involving criminal actions
COMMUNIST_ACTIVITIES.quote: Communists--responsible for a wave of hold-ups, burglaries, and attacks on police posts designed to obtain funds, weapons, and explosives.

OPERATIONAL_SECRECY.quote: The 201 machine listings should include the identities of persons of operational interest because of their connection with a target group or organization

ANSPELL_UNDERGROUND_ACTIVITIES.description: Document discusses underground activities and guerrilla warfare efforts in Cuba in November 1962

CUBAN_RESISTANCE_FINANCING.description: Attachment B contains a detailed analysis of Cuban underground financing for October 1962
CUBAN_RESISTANCE_FINANCING.quote: Attachment B is a report of underground financing for October 1962 and is the first detailed analysis of Cuban finances ever received by JMWAVE

INTELLIGENCE_COORDINATION.description: Document shows inter-agency communication about covert activities
INTELLIGENCE_COORDINATION.quote: Forwarded under separate cover as Attachment A is a copy of the original, and translation of a letter from the National Coordination Committee of ANSPELL in Cuba dated 28 November 1962

relationships.description: CIA and State Department tracking Oswald since 1959 when he traveled to Russia
relationships.quote: OS holdings on Lee Harvey Oswald began in 1959 with his travel to Russia during which he renounced his US citizenship. Oswald was in contact with the American Embassy in Moscow, and the Department of State prepared reports on these contacts.
